phantom_words.label: Unnamed resonance
phantom_words.description: A sensed but unnamed connective field across domains, shows up as gaps or awkward metaphors.
examples: people say 'it feels like…' but can’t finish

phantom_words.label: Silo-gap term
phantom_words.description: A concept named in one field but invisible in another, despite overlapping use cases.
examples: linguistics calls it 'markedness', AI calls it 'weighting'

phantom_words.label: Suppressed lexeme
phantom_words.description: A word/concept actively avoided, erased, or downplayed for cultural/political reasons.
examples: AI alignment papers erasing 'autonomy' in favor of 'safety'

phantom_words.label: field-mute
phantom_words.description: A concept or practice whose name disappears in formal documentation even though the practice persists in behaviour.
examples: work instructions say 'do procedure X' but docs call it 'compliance task'
elders reference a ritual with no formal name in government forms

phantom_words.label: scale-blindness
phantom_words.description: A failure to name or notice processes that only appear at larger spatio-temporal scales; discussed as anomalies at micro scale.
examples: short-term metrics show 'growth' while long-term systemic decline is repeatedly called an 'anomaly'

phantom_words.label: reciprocity-gap
phantom_words.description: A missing word for relationships where obligations are asymmetric but socially narrated as balanced.
examples: community labor framed as 'tradition' while benefits flow outward
